messageBody:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/files/Resources/Second%
20Shaw.htm#First%20Shaw

Second Shaw Alphabet: by John Zuck

Only two widely distributed descriptions of the alphabet were
published, Quikscript[sic?]: Its Alphabet and Manual, by Read, (QM),
and Cole Turley's extensive article on it in The Surprise Edition of
Cole's Funny Picture Book No. 2, (CFPB), both of which are
available from Roger Collin.

PURPOSE of this revision to the Shaw Alphabet

Simplification: While all of the First Shaw alphabet's sounds are
retained, the stress distinctions between Ado / Up and Array / Err
are eliminated.

Enhancement: The "wh" sound no longer has to written with the
distracting hw. A new character ` (Whitewheat) indicates the sound
concisely and beautifully. Additional minor enhancements include
letters æ and ç for the proper sounds in Celtic names (note that ç
is useful also for German names and words).
